lead_paragraph: Stevens, a 52-year-old jockey, retired twice from horse racing and had a knee replacement, and still he cannot wait to be riding Firing Line on Saturday in the Preakness.

headline.print_headline: Thrill of Chase Keeps Jockey Returning
headline.main: Thrill of the Chase Keeps Gary Stevens Coming Back

snippet: Stevens, a 52-year-old jockey, retired twice from horse racing and had a knee replacement, and still he cannot wait to be riding Firing Line on Saturday in the Preakness.
abstract: Jockey Gary Stevens, who rode Firing Line to second place finish in Kentucky Derby, has come back from retirement twice because thrill of chase makes it impossible for him to stay away from sport; looks forward to rematch against American Pharoah at Preakness Stakes.
